title: Officials: Charlie Kirk’s killer blended in on campus; high-powered rifle recovered
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Charlie Kirk was shot and killed by a sniper at Utah Valley University; the shooter has not been identified.
Authorities believe the shooter, appearing college-aged, blended in with the campus and escaped after the attack.
A high-powered rifle was recovered at the scene; Utah Governor called the attack a political assassination.

title: ‘Laughable’: College football analyst’s blunt take on Bill Belichick’s start at UNC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Bill Belichick's start as UNC's head coach began poorly with a 48-14 loss to TCU.
Belichick faced criticism for banning Patriots scouts from UNC facilities after a victory over Charlotte.
ESPN's Paul Finebaum described Belichick's early tenure at UNC as 'laughable' on 'The Rich Eisen Show.'

title: This Mass. woman just placed 2nd on NBC’s ‘American Ninja Warrior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Addy Herman placed 2nd in NBC's 'American Ninja Warrior: Women's Championship' despite recovering from an ankle injury.
Noah Meunier, Herman's boyfriend, also secured 2nd place overall in the latest season of 'American Ninja Warrior'.
Herman and Meunier set a Guinness World Record and have been influential figures in New England's ninja sports community.

title: 5 can’t-miss restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston this week
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Capricho Colombian Steakhouse is opening at 1627 Beacon St., Brookline, offering wood-grilled prime cuts and live music.
Elephantine Bakery from Portsmouth is expanding with a soft opening in Boston’s Seaport at 332 Congress St.
Eastern Standard's Pickle Week events include a pickle party with snacks and pickle gin martinis on Sept. 12-13.

title: Do the Bruins have a potential breakout prospect in camp in Dans Locmelis?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Dans Locmelis impressed at the 2025 IIHF World Championships with Latvia, scoring four goals and six points over seven games.
Locmelis signed an entry-level deal with the Boston Bruins and recorded 12 points during Providence Bruins' Calder Cup run.
Providence coach Ryan Mougenel is optimistic about Locmelis' potential, praising his courage and quick adaptation to the AHL.

title: Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rob Gronkowski criticized Patriots QB Drake Maye for looking 'timid' during the 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Maye completed 14-of-20 throws for 150 yards and a touchdown in the first half but struggled in the second half.
The Patriots face questions about Maye's readiness as they prepare for Week 2 against the Dolphins.

title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Minh Dang, 64, from Braintree, died following injuries from an e-bike collision in Copley Square on August 6.
Dang was struck near the Boston Public Library at Huntington Avenue and Dartmouth Street; he succumbed to life-threatening injuries.
The e-bike operator stayed at the scene, and police have not filed any charges in connection with the incident.

title: Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: King tides, known scientifically as perigean spring tides, will cause Boston Harbor's ocean levels to rise 2-4 feet this fall.
The phenomenon is linked to the moon's proximity to Earth and its alignment with the Sun and Earth.
The Stone Living Lab will host high tide events at Long Wharf from September through December with scheduled monthly occurrences.

title: Stefon Diggs says Drake Maye isn’t a ‘softie’ when it comes to criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs supports Patriots QB Drake Maye, stating he's open to criticism and not a 'softie'.
Drake Maye completed 30 of 46 passes for 287 yards with one touchdown and one interception against the Raiders.
Stefon Diggs debuted with six catches for 57 yards after returning from an ACL injury in Sunday's game.

title: Audit: K-12 school department failed to investigate 22 child abuse reports
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: State audit reveals DESE failed to investigate 22 supported child abuse reports between 2020 and 2023.
Audit criticizes DESE for delays in addressing special education complaints, impacting timely student support.
Audit notes DESE missed key responsibilities for the Massachusetts Commission on LGBTQ Youth training and policies.
